title: Business Models: Fasttracking Competitive Advantage
abstractText:
The collapse of well-known UK High Street names has shown the importance of having a business model that is capable of both creating and capturing value. Business models describe how the firm differentiates itself and deals with competition. Yet, recent research indicates that over 66 per cent of firms have given no thought to their business model and are unable to articulate it.

This research seminar series explores fundamental questions relating to business models in practice, how they work beyond the boundaries of the firm and into the wider business network and market, how certain models come to dominate sectors and how are they created, driven, picked-up, dropped or transformed.

The research seminar series comprises the following 8 seminars:

  • Business Models: Rationale, applications and inter-organisationality (February 2014)
  • Business models and resource configuration (July 2014)
  • Business model design, prototyping and testing (November 2014)
  • Business models and structural choices, (March 2014)
  • Business Models: An Activity System Perspective, (June 2015)
  • Product-Service Systems and the servitisation of manufacturing, (October 2015)
  • Value and Outcome-based contracts as New Business Models: a Service-Dominant Logic Approach, (February 2016)
  • Business Models: Shaping Organisations and markets (June 2016)
organisation: University of the West of England
